Package org.jutil

Class Util

java.lang.Object
org.jutil.Util
public class Util extends Object
General utility class with static methods, written for convenience reasons.

  • Method Details

    • blockingConfirmDlg

      public static void blockingConfirmDlg(String message, String title, int messageType)
      Blocks the current thread until a message dialog is confirmed. Uses SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait() and JOptionPane.showMessageDialog() to do this.
      Parameters:
      message - the message
      title - the title of the dialog
      messageType - the message type of the dialog (e.g. JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE)
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if called on the event dispatch thread

    • createDateAndTimeStamp

      public static String createDateAndTimeStamp()
      Creates a date and time stamp (without milliseconds) as a String, like "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss".
      Returns:
      the date and time stamp string

    • createTimeStamp

      public static String createTimeStamp()
      Creates a time stamp (without milliseconds, without date) as a String, like "HH:mm:ss".
      Returns:
      the time stamp string

    • idListToString

      public static String idListToString(ArrayList<Integer> ids)
      Returns a space separated String of all integer elements of an ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      ids - the ArrayList
      Returns:
      the string

    • prompt

      public static String prompt(String text)
      Prompts for a text message in the System.out window, blocks until the user types RETURN/ENTER and returns the string typed in. This method intentionally encapsulates possible exceptions.
      Parameters:
      text - the text string to be displayed
      Returns:
      a String containing the input

    • readFromUrl

      public static String readFromUrl(String url) throws Exception
      Reads the content of an URL into a String object.
      Note: this is a very simple wget.
      Parameters:
      url - the URL to read from
      Returns:
      the content of the URL
      Throws:
      Exception - in case of unexpected exceptions

    • renameToBackupFile

      public static void renameToBackupFile(String fileName, String backupFileName) throws IOException
      Renames a file to a backup file, if the file exists . If an old backup file exists already, it is deleted before renaming the file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to be the backup file
      backupFileName - the name of backup file
      Throws:
      IOException - in case of unexpected exceptions or write/delete errors

    • sleep

      public static void sleep(long millis)
      Convenience method for Thread.sleep(millis).
      An InterruptedException will be ignored, the stack trace is shown on System.out.
      Note: the thread calling this method will sleep. Therefore, if one calls it from the event dispatching thread, a RuntimeException is thrown - otherwise the GUI would freeze.
      Parameters:
      millis - the milliseconds to sleep
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the current thread is the event dispatching thread

    • notImplementedException

      public static void notImplementedException()
      Convenience method for Thread.sleep(millis).
      An InterruptedException will be ignored, the stack trace is shown on System.out.
      Note: the thread calling this method will sleep. Therefore, if one calls it from the event dispatching thread, a RuntimeException is thrown - cause the GUI would freeze.
      Parameters:
      millis - the milliseconds to sleep
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the current thread is the event dispatching thread

    • writeFile

      public static void writeFile(String fileName, String content) throws IOException
      Writes the content of a String object to a file.
      Parameters:
      fileName -
      content -
      Throws:
      IOException
